snippet: The instructions, from the patrol’s chief, came after a series of fatal shootings by agents provoked outrage from human rights activists and the Mexican government.
abstract: Border Patrol instructs its agents to show restraint when people on the border throw rocks or flee in cars; series of fatal shootings by agents have provoked outrage from human rights activists and Mexican government; critics of the Border Patrol question how much practical change will result from the instructions, calling them, at best, a positive first step.
